messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Comics was: NEW unschooling thread
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m going to get her a bunch of comic books and magazine subscriptions too. Okay. I ve got a better picture of where her reading is now. :o) Comics are
messages.messageBody:
>>The books above are too difficult and intimidating, she prefers the larger
>>print of the easy readers but the stories are "dumb"
I'm going to get her a bunch of comic books and magazine subscriptions
too.>>

Okay. I've got a better picture of where her reading is now. :o)

Comics are definitely a great way to go. Garfield and Peanuts were good ones
for Conor to start. Then he eventually moved on to Foxtrot, Calvin & Hobbes,
Zits and Doonesbury. Those latter ones are great for discussion as well as
reading practice BTW. Politics, science, human relations, philosophy...it's
all in there.

Life is good.
~Mary
